page.title: 06Critchley's fruit farm.
page.content: Critchleys self-pick fruit farm has been open for 10 years whilst the owners have lived there for 20 years.It is their living. They have 100 acers of fields half of which are fruit and half are corn.They do not keep the crops in the same place because they have a rotation every 3 years.The farm does not make alot of profit because they had a terrible June in 1985.They have only one employee.The seeds they get themselves from other Manufacturers.The farm has cut down on sprays because of the cost.But they still keep strawberries the same price 35p-1b. The farm is cutting down every month and every year which means eventually they will have to close altogether because of the lack of profits in self pick fruit farms.
